thread.title: Arnold Schwarzenegger Responds To Donald Trump's Dismal Approval Ratings With A Shady Video Message To The President!
thread.title_full: Arnold Schwarzenegger Responds To Donald Trump's Dismal Approval Ratings With A Shady Video Message To The President!

author: Perez Hilton
title: Arnold Schwarzenegger Responds To Donald Trump's Dismal Approval Ratings With A Shady Video Message To The President!
text:
Donald Trump 's ratings are in!
And not unlike that of Celebrity Apprentice , the president's approval ratings can be described as " bad (pathetic) ," with a dismal 39 percent -- or as teachers would say... " see you in summer school, dumbass. " 
So, you better believe Arnold Schwarzenegger took the golden opportunity to knock Trump's embarrassing numbers in a scathing Twitter video.
Related: Arnold WON'T Be Back For More Celebrity Apprentice ! 
In the clip, the Terminator star blasted POTUS for getting "swamped" in the ratings -- in which, according to a Gallup poll, showed 6 out of 10 respondents disapprove of the way Trump is handling his presidency.
And Arnie already has some ideas as to why that might be, telling his reality TV predecessor: 
"But what do you expect? I mean, when you take away after-school programs for children and Meals on Wheels for the poor people, that's not what you call 'making America great again.' Come on!"
The former California governor ended his message by inviting Trump to come with him to a middle school near the White House to check out its after-school programs.
Related: Trump Plummets Over 200 Spots On Forbes ' Billionaires List! 
That sure would be great, but we think the President rather stick with basking in the applause of his supporters by holding campaign-style rallies and tweeting conspiracies about Barack Obama . No wonder he's failing so miserably with the people...
Watch Arnie's hilariously shady message to Trump (below)!
Hey, @realDonaldTrump , I have some advice. See you at Hart Middle School? Here's more info about #afterschool : https://t.co/NOgdhBHyyp pic.twitter.com/NQI2OdVqtF 
â€” Arnold (@Schwarzenegger) March 21, 2017 
[ Image via C-SPAN / NBC . ]
